document_title: Chronic tonsillitis: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Tonsillitis is an inflammation of the tonsils in the pharynx. The inflammation can affect other areas in the back of the throat, including the nasopharynx and lingual tonsils.
According to M.D. Nguyen Thi Thuc Nhu - Doctor of Ear, Nose and Throat Department, Tam Anh General Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City, tonsillitis is divided into two types: acute tonsillitis and chronic tonsillitis. What is chronic tonsillitis? Chronic tonsillitis is a persistent infection of the tonsils that lasts more than 2 weeks and can lead to recurrences multiple times a year.
Chronic tonsillitis is divided into 2 types:
Purulent tonsillitis: A condition in which the tonsil cavities become inflamed and swollen, causing milky white pus like bean residue. The cause is due to the accumulation of food and other residues, creating conditions for bacteria to enter and cause disease.; Purulent tonsillitis: A condition in which the tonsil cavities become inflamed and swollen, causing milky white pus like bean residue. The cause is the accumulation of food and other residue, creating conditions for bacteria to enter and cause disease.
Atrophic tonsillitis: A condition of chronic, long-term tonsillitis leading to atrophy of the tonsils; Atrophic tonsillitis: A condition of chronic, long-term tonsillitis leading to atrophy of the tonsils.
